article.description: No need to tear up those brackets. Emeka Okafor and Connecticut sent BYU home.
article.headline: Okafor stands tall for fifth-seeded Huskies

images.name: Okafor Emeka 030320 inline
images.caption: Emeka Okafor had 20 points and seven blocked shots to lead UConn to victory.

article.linkText: BY-Phew! UConn saves bracket by beating BYU
article.story: PROVO, Utah (AP) -- Mike Rose scored 17 points and Rafael Araujo had 14 points and 14 rebounds in Brigham Young's 104-58 exhibition win over Northwest Sports on Tuesday night. Mark Bigelow and Jared Jensen each finished with 12 points and Mike Hall scored 11 for the Cougars, who led 43-24 at halftime and shot 56.3 percent (40-for-71) in the game. Terry Nashiff had six assists and Luiz Lemes had five assists for BYU, which also outrebounded Northwest Sports 47-30. Former University of Utah point guard Marc Jackson led Northwest Sports with 12 points.
